benchmark_details.name: CausalGraph2LLM
benchmark_details.overview: CausalGraph2LLM is a comprehensive benchmark comprising over 700k queries across diverse causal graph settings to evaluate the causal reasoning capabilities of LLMs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate the ability of LLMs to encode causal graphs and their effectiveness in assisting with causal reasoning tasks.

data.source: Synthetic and real-world datasets(Such as Insurance and Alarm causal graphs)
data.format: JSON, Adjacency, GraphML, GraphViz, Multi node, Single node

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correctness of LLM's responses to causal queries.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better understanding and reasoning capabilities of causal graphs.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments on various models and encoding strategies.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential biases introduced based on contextual knowledge.
